alert.note: Alert for Archer; Baylor; Foard; Knox (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 04 at 5:44PM CDT until October 04 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Archer County in northern Texas... Baylor County in northern Texas... Southern Foard County in northern Texas... Knox County in northern Texas... * Until 845 PM CDT. * At 544 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Areas of between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area through the early evening as storms move from west to east. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Seymour, Archer City, Munday, Knox City, Benjamin, Holliday, Scotland, Windthorst, Goree, Megargel, Mabelle, Lake Kemp, Red Springs, Bomarton, Westover, Lake Diversion, Vera, Dundee, Lake Kickapoo and Rhineland. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
